timeline.author: victoralfaro-dotcms

replies.bodyText: Why having nested try-catches if you are throwing a DotRuntimeException to be caught outside the loop?
replies.author: victoralfaro-dotcms

replies.bodyText: Because these exceptions need to be logged but never interrupt the whole process. This logic is part of a full reindex, which can take a lot of time in large datasets. Here, it is important to give more priority to the full process itself, because otherwise the application is useless, even when just setting a field mapping fails.

replies.bodyText: By the way, the stream() suggestion was applied
